required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on November 19, 2021
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Efficacy and Safety of Three Doses of Florence Oral Suspension in Adults With Eosinophilic Esophagitis
clinical_study.official_title: Randomized, Double-blind, Multicentric, Parallel, National, Phase II Clinical Trial to Evaluate the Efficacy and Safety of Three Doses of Florence Oral Suspension in Adults With Eosinophilic Esophagitis

brief_summary.textblock: The purpose of this study is to evaluate the efficacy of three doses of Florence oral suspension on changes of eosinophilic infiltration in esophageal biopsies.

primary_outcome.measure: Proportion of participants presenting a histological response, defined as the presence of ≤ 6 eosinophils/high-power field, at the end of treatment.

secondary_outcome.measure: Incidence and severity of adverse events recorded during the study.
